tasks.task: Planning and designing a dam for construction
subtasks: Researching and understanding different types of dams (one-wall, two-wall, three-wall)
Considering landscape to determine appropriate dam type
Ensuring compliance with legislation for dam construction
Prioritizing dam longevity in planning and design
Positioning the outlet to match water inflow and prevent erosion
Installing a trickle pipe to maintain outlet dryness and prevent paddock flooding
Ensuring proper water coverage during dam filling to prevent erosion
Using good clay material for dam construction and proper compaction to prevent leaks
Maintaining proper batter angles (three to one on front and two and a half to three to one on back) for dam stability
Ensuring sufficient freeboard (at least one meter) to maintain dam safety

tasks.task: Excavating and constructing the dam foundation
subtasks: Removing topsoil from excavation site
Building the dam wall using compacted clay material
Creating a key line where clay meets ground by laying clay directly on clay
Constructing the dam with a wide crest (three meters) for stability
Reinforcing the backside of the dam with a well-defined batter angle

tasks.task: Ensuring proper outlet and trickle pipe installations
subtasks: Designing and positioning the outlet to discharge water free of the dam
Selecting an appropriate spill area that minimizes erosion and damage
Installing a trickle pipe to direct excess water behind the dam and maintain grassed area
Positioning trickle pipe along natural water flow path to prevent soil disruption
Regularly monitoring dam integrity and freeboard levels
Inspecting outlets and trickle pipes for signs of erosion or damage
Implementing preventive measures to address any structural issues promptly
Performing routine inspections for leaks or stability concerns
